did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Contains political, business, and personal correspondence, newspaper clippings, reports, and photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: With the exception of Subgroup 3, Series 1, there are no access restrictions. Because of the confidential nature of Subgroup 3, Series 1, these records have been closed to researchers until 2028.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: James F. McNulty Papers (MS 341). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James “Jim” F. McNulty, Jr. has been a resident of Arizona since 1946. He was born in Boston, Massachusetts on October 18, 1925. After graduating from Boston Latin School, he entered the United States Army, and served until the end of WWII. After WWII, McNulty entered the University of Arizona in Tucson, Arizona and attended the University of Arizona College of Law, graduating in 1951. After graduation, he joined the firm of Gentry and Gentry in Bisbee, Arizona.
McNulty married Jacqueline “Jackie” Boevers of Clinton, Arizona in 1950. They are the parents of three children, Michael, Cynthia, and Amy.

McNulty served as city attorney for Bisbee, Tombstone, and Huachuca City. He has been a member of the State Board of Education, the State Hospital Board, the Board of Governors at the state and county level, the Arizona Board of Regents, Catholic Charities, the Board of Visitors for the University of Arizona College of Law, and various volunteer and charitable organizations throughout Southeastern Arizona.

In 1968, McNulty was elected to the Arizona State Senate, where he served until 1975. While a member of the Senate, he won support from Republican leaders as well as his fellow Democrats. During his tenure in the Senate, McNulty was known for his high morals and honesty and enjoyed a reputation as an extremely effective legislator.

McNulty has long been active in the Democratic Party. He has served as County Chairman of Cochise County, Precinct Committee person, delegate to the 1960 Democratic National Convention, Arizona member of the National Democratic Party Platform Committee in 1960, Vice-chairperson of the Arizona Democratic Party, Southern Arizona Coordinator for the Carter/Mondale 1976 Presidential Campaign, and State Co-Chairman of the 1978 Babbitt for Governor Campaign Committee.

McNulty ran for the House of Representatives in 1976 but dropped out of the race when Morris Udall was defeated in his run for the White House and decided to retain his seat in the House. McNulty ran for the U.S. Senate in 1980 and was defeated. McNulty was successful in running for the House of Representatives in 1982, but was defeated in his re-election bid by Jim Kolbe. After his term in the House of Representatives, McNulty retired to private practice in Tucson, Arizona.

McNulty returned to Tucson in January, 1985 and became a partner with the firm of Bilby and Shoenhair which was merged into the firm of Snell and Wilmer in May, 1989. He was a senior partner in each firm. He served briefly in Guatemala with the Peace Corps. After the Peace Corps, he practiced law with the firm of brown and Bain in Tucson. He served as a member of the Board of Governors of the State Bar Board of Governors and was a member of the Arizona Bar Foundation, the American Bar Association, and the Pima County Bar Association. He passed away on June 30, 2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into eight subgroups:

list.item: Subgroup VI: Newspaper Clippings and Scrapbooks 1930's-1990's
Subgroup VII: Travel Slides no date

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the activities of James F. McNulty, who was a member of the Arizona State Senate from 1968 till 1975, and a member of The United States House of Representatives from 1982 to 1984. The political papers housed in this collection include materials from 1957-1985, such as McNulty’s various activities within the Democratic Party, which include correspondences, reports, minutes, pamphlets from the 1960 DNC and material associated with a 1962 national delegation to the USSR. The collection also comprises a wealth of documentation concerning McNulty’s various volunteering activities, his involvement in 4-H, Arizona Board of Regents, Arizona State Bar Association, Arizona State Board of Education, Catholic Church, the Cochise County Hospital Association and the Copper Queen Hospital Association, Health Systems Agency of Southern Arizona, Arizona State Hospital, the League of Arizona Cities and Towns, the University of Arizona College of Law. It also includes personal materials, including the records of McNulty’s business (his legal files are closed until 2028), files relating to Cochise Junior College and DSET, personal and family material from 1953 to 1986. The “Photographs” subgroup contains official and unofficial photographs and postcards documenting McNulty’s 1962 visit to the USSR, a collection of photographs taken during McNulty’s time in the House of Representatives, and miscellaneous photos of McNulty in the military, at the University of Arizona, throughout his state political career. Also included are several collections of newspaper clippings and scrapbooks from 1943 to 1997, one collection specifically documenting McNulty’s stint in the U. S. House of Representatives, and another documenting the 1982 campaign for the House of Representatives. Also included are slides from various travels to Russia, Canada and the Southwest. Finally, there is a grouping of certificates and memorabilia reflecting McNulty’s dedication to his profession, politics, the University of Arizona and the state of Arizona.

item.subject: Politics and governments of the American states

scopecontent.p: "Political Activity," contains political material from 1957-1985. Series One consists of McNulty’s Democratic Party activities, which includes correspondence, reports, minutes, as well as pamphlets from the 1960 Democratic National Convention and McNulty’s trip to the USSR in 1962 as part of a national delegation with Secretary of the Interior Stewart Udall. Series Two contains material from the Arizona State Senate, and includes correspondence, reports, voting records, and his work on the Commission on salaries for elective state officers during the 33rd legislature (1977-1978). Series Three consists of material from his various campaigns. Series Four consists of material collected while serving in the U.S. House of Representatives (1982-1984). This series contains, correspondence, and reports. Photographs and newspaper clippings for these corresponding years can be found in subgroup five and six.

scopecontent.p: "Volunteer Activity," consists of material covering his volunteer activities from 1958-1983. Series One consists of his involvement with the 4-H Club. This series includes correspondence and reports. Series Two contains material regarding McNulty’s involvement with the Arizona Board of Regents (1980-1983). This series contains correspondence, budget requests, reports, intercollegiate athletics, minutes, and search committee for selecting a new president. Series Three consists of materials relating to the Arizona State Bar Association (1958-1979). This series contains mostly correspondence and minutes. Series Four is the Arizona State Board of Education (1965-1977). This series contains mostly correspondence and minutes. Series Five includes material documenting McNulty’s involvement with the Catholic Church. Series Six contains material relating to his involvement with the Cochise County Hospital Association and the Copper Queen Hospital Association. Series Seven contains material relating to McNulty’s involvement with the Health Systems Agency of Southeastern Arizona (1976-1978). Series Eight contains records documenting McNulty's involvement with the Arizona State Hospital (1958-1965). This series contains correspondence as well as meeting minutes as well as reports. Because of the sensitive nature of the material, these items have been sealed until 2028. Series Nine consists of records created during his involvement with the League of Arizona Cities and Towns (1958-1960). Series Ten consists of records created during his involvement with the University of Arizona College of Law (1967-1979). Series Eleven contains miscellaneous organizations that McNulty was involved with between the1950’s-1970’s.

scopecontent.p: "Legal/Business," consists of materials collected from his legal and business practices. Series One contains an alphabetical listing of his legal files. Because of the confidential nature of these files, Series one is closed to researchers until the year 2028. Series Two contains items from his business files relating to Cochise Junior College and DSET. Series Three contains correspondence and memo files from 1993 through 2002, while he was practicing law with the firm of Brown and Bain in Tucson.

scopecontent.p: "Personal/Family," contains personal and family materials collected between 1953-1986. Series One consists of personal correspondence that is arranged chronologically. There are also several files that are by topic that have been kept in their original order. Series Two contains items from his personal and family life such as items relating back to his high school days at Boston Latin and his time in the military.

did.unittitle: Personal—Catechism of Christian Doctrine, Nancy McNulty,
Personal—University of Arizona College of Law Outstanding Graduate Award,
Personal—Brewery Gulch Gazette: Death of J. F. K.,

scopecontent.p: "Photographs," contains photographs collected over the years and is divided into three series. Series One consists of photographs taken during McNulty’s 1962 visit to the USSR. The series contains both official and unofficial photographs as well as postcards collected during the visit. Series Two contains photographs taken during his time in the House of Representatives. This section includes photographs taken during the campaign. The series contains many photographs taken with prominent members of the House of Representatives as well as with many world dignitaries. Series Three, “Miscellaneous Photographs,” is arranged alphabetically according to subject. This section contains photographs taken while McNulty was in the military, at the University of Arizona, and through out his state political career. There are also photographs of McNulty with Robert Frost and with John F. Kennedy Jr.

did.unittitle: Series 1: Delegation to the USSR, August 1962

scopecontent.p: "Newspaper Clippings and Scrapbooks," is a collection of newspaper clippings documenting Jim McNulty’s life and career. Series One contains newspaper clippings dating from 1943-1997. Series Two consists of newspaper clippings collected during his stint in the U.S. House of Representatives (1981-1984). Series Three is a scrapbook created during the 1982 Campaign for the House of Representatives.

scopecontent.p: Slides from travels to Russia, Canada and the Southwest.

scopecontent.p: Awards, certificates and memorabilia reflecting McNulty’s dedication to his profession, politics, the University of Arizona and the state of Arizona. This includes numerous plaques and trophies along with personal ephemera.

scopecontent.p: Materials are presented in KCS20, UCA20S, MBU18S, MBU-15S, BCS-20, 197 BCA-60, KCA60, UCA60, VHS, audiocassette tape, 45 rpm record, Quadruplex videotape and various reel-to-reel audio recordings. Formatting is noted where possible. The final box in this subgroup is almost exclusively audio material. These materials seem to be primarily concerned with Jim McNulty’s political career.
